statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Fairfield 76, Niagara 72
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Jonathan Han recorded a team-high 16 points to go with nine assists as Fairfield recorded a 76-72 victory over Niagara Sunday afternoon in Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference play. Fairfield (8-14, 6-6 MAAC) also got 15 points from Herbie Allen and 10 points each from Greg Nero, Anthony Johnson and Yorel Hawkins. Fairfield, which made its first 18 free throws, sank 20-of-23 free throws. Niagara (13-7, 7-4 MAAC) was led by Stanley Hodge, who had a career-high 21 points. Charron Fisher added 18 points while Benson Egemonye and Tyrone Lewis added 14 and 11 points, respectively. Fairfield opened a 31-18 lead when Han converted a fast-break attempt at 8:31. The Stags opened the game making their first four three-point field goal attempts. Warren Edney gave the Stags a 14-point lead, 41-27, when he sank a 15-foot jump shot with 3:26 to play. The Stags made all 13 of their free throws in the first half and held a 45-36 lead at halftime. Allen had 11 points while Han added nine. Niagara opened the second half with a 7-0 run before Han answered with a three-pointer to spark an 8-3 run and give Fairfield a 53-45 lead. The Purple Eagles tied the game, 57-57, at 11:47 when Andrew Patterson sank his second-straight three pointer. Egemonye dunked after picking up a loose ball to give Niagara a 60-59 lead at 10:20. Han then made two free throws at 6:19 to give Fairfield a 66-64 lead. Mike Evanovich sank a three-pointer at 5:43 to play and a 69-64 lead. Niagara cut the lead to two points, the last being 74-72, on two Hodge free throws with 11.2 seconds left but could not tie the game.
